reviews.review_msg: I am so fortunate to have studied under Darelle during my 1st semester at Beedie. I looked forward to attending this class each week & I credit that to her. In a time of gloom, she brightened up my day. She was the highlight of my week. Darelle is everything you want in an SFU instructor. I am grateful for the time spent learning/growing with her.

BUS 217W, in general, is a more challenging course, but Darelle makes it enjoyable. She emphasizes improvement, not perfection, and is always there for you. As long as you put in the work, participate in class by asking questions and appreciating your classmates, and seek help from her and your TAs, you will succeed. I hope to take BUS 360W w/ her.
She is terrible. Take 217 with someone else. Marks unfairly. Grading criteria is vague. Annoying personality.
Darelle is a super nice person! She is open to our feedback and very supportive. There are a lot of assignments, but that's BUS217.

Hands down the most unfair prof I have ever experienced. Terrible explanation for assignments and the marking is so tough without having the prior knowledge to avoid the strict marking. Class average was very low all semester and she seemed okay with it because it is curved. Dont understand how that is okay. We want to do well not just get by...

She sucks! I would not recommend taking a class with her. She grades unfairly. She nitpicks on everything. She gives out unclear instructions. Her lectures are so boring. She is just dreadful. I hated going to her class. The feedback that she gave was vague and unhelpful. Do yourself a favour and take 217 with someone else.

Brent is one of the nicest and most caring profs I've ever had! He always encourages students to reach out for help and is always there for help if needed. I would definitely recommend taking any course that he teaches because he is an excellent instructor.

Brent is literally the sweetest prof ever. You can tell he really cares about his students and helps them to do better. His OH is very helpful, instructions are clear. I rarely write review for a prof but Brent is the REAL GEM. I almost cried a lil when our class ended LOL. Overall, highly recommended.

Taking 217W with Brent makes you think it is not as difficult as what people usually say. Clear rubric and explanations, detailed feedback, helpful office hours, and instant email responses, Brent is THE GOAT. Work hard and critically think about what is really expected in assignments will guarantee you a more than satisfactory grade!
Brent is a solid choice for BUS 217W, he takes his time and gives constructive feedback on work so you can improve your grade. Also, there is no final exam so that is a plus.

Jane had long, boring lectures. Tough, rigorous marking. Looks for very specific work, attention to detail is an absolute MUST in her class. Lots of group work. People don't usually do well in 217, but I did my best to stand out and put in lots of effort and it paid off for me in Jane's class. Be prepared to go the extra mile to be above the curve.

Jane loves group work. Course was divided into 4 main assignments (15% each) and lots of little quizzes and activities worth less than 10% each. Very long, boring lectures but content was very simple. Class avg was low on every assignment, but gave good feedback for how to improve. Just pay close attention to detail + get all the easy marks.
NOT a good instructor for this course! Could not learn anything from him! Waste of money and time
A very nice prof, choose him without any doubts.

Zahra is very down to earth and will answer any specific questions you have during the lecture. But it is important to stay focused, take notes, and review after class. Make sure you actually read the survival guide. Her TA Adam was very helpful and often extended his office hour to help students. If you can write decently you will be okay.

Unclear throughout the course. All assignment expectations not outlined prior, especially in class group submissions. Class went online halfway through the semester and she taught pretty much nothing you cannot google in five seconds. Seems like she does not want to help you succeed in the class

Carcano makes it quite difficult to have clear directions for assignments. Often times students are left on their own to figure out what they're suppose to do. Markers are very unpredictable and will give you whatever mark they want

Fine prof, she was not that bad compared to others. However, the marking done by the TA's was overly strict and made the whole process 10x harder then it had to be. They never gave a clear answer on how to approach an essay. Basically threw us in the deep end and never showed us how to do well.

Luana was sweet and encourage class participation. She took the time to get to know her students. However, she would always show up 5 minutes late to lecture. Not only this but the grading on papers felt like they wanted you to fail. The instructions were always vague and when seeking help, it was difficult to get a clear answer. Would avoid...

Luana is an amazing professor, and her teaching team certainly carries a lot of the weight in grading. Her lectures are engaging and she encourages participation in almost every aspect. She is truly passionate about whats she does, and she makes an effort to get to know each student in the class! Certainly, take this class with her if you can!

I think Matt Martel is one of the better profs for bus 217 but this course is horribly organized, with unclear rubric with hard marking. A great portion of your grade will come from group work so pray you have a good group. Theres in class writing stuff and it's hell. Brace yourselves for this course.

He's not bad for BUS 217. One thing to note that this course doesn't really teach anything notable, and you'll mainly have to figure things out from trial and error. There are strict business guiding principles for major assignments so keep that in mind. Averages are low for them though (~55%). Just try your best and hope for the best.

Very well spoken and interesting lectures. His curriculum structure is weird though, maybe because he had just started teaching my class. He would often set out assignments that he had not taught how to do yet, which was frustrating. But overall very interesting class and a fun professor.
